definition: good-looking/charming/(of goods) in great demand/(coll.) to season (food)

sentences.english: My little son nipped in with a smart question.
sentences.chinese: 我的小兒子插話問了一個俏皮的問題。

sentences.english: I don't think Linda appreciated my wisecracks .
sentences.chinese: 我看琳達好像不怎麼喜歡我的俏皮話。

sentences.english: “IT'S good to talk”, says the snappy slogan of a British telecoms company.
sentences.chinese: “聊天真好”，這句俏皮的廣告語源自英國電信。

sentences.english: At the moment another witty word swam into his mind.
sentences.chinese: 馬上又一句俏皮話出現在他的腦子裏。

sentences.english: Don't worry, he's still full of one-liners and quips.
sentences.chinese: 別擔心，他仍然滿嘴俏皮話一針見血。

sentences.english: Stars like the nifty Xiaomao Hai, the general people love.
sentences.chinese: 星星就像俏皮的小毛孩，一般讓人喜愛。
活潑俏皮，興奮感，都是她所愛。

sentences.english: Wit has truth in it ; wisecracking is simply calisthenics with words.
sentences.chinese: 智慧中有真理，說俏皮話僅僅是一種文字健身運動。

sentences.english: From under the veil, he thought he saw her give him a saucy glance.
sentences.chinese: 他在想，她可能在面紗後面給了自己一個俏皮的一瞥。

sentences.english: Things are about to get a little saucy in the land we call Science Buzz.
sentences.chinese: 在《嗡嗡科學》上，事情都會帶點小俏皮。

sentences.english: She continued her story undisturbed by the merry sallies of her hearers.
sentences.chinese: 她繼續她的故事而不受她的聽衆的歡樂俏皮話所打擾。

sentences.english: The latter is an enjoyable rap song which shows the playful side of Lee Hom.
sentences.chinese: 後者是一首歡快的饒舌歌，表現了力宏俏皮的一面。

sentences.english: Heidi pretends to shoot around, Tsai and Cheng fall down in cooperation.
sentences.chinese: 海蒂俏皮地做掃射狀，蔡和鄭配合地倒下。

sentences.english: And some were just waiting to make their share of animal puns.
sentences.chinese: 還有一些人專門等着抖出和動物有關的俏皮話呢。

sentences.english: Sometimes at the next jump, looks like a playful baby.
sentences.chinese: 有時會上下跳躍，活像一個俏皮的孩兒。

sentences.english: The little boy had a wicked twinkle in his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 這個男孩地眼睛裏閃耀着俏皮地光。
